p:
The decentralization of the Italian health system also prevented uniform measures from being adopted across the country
9 . Restrictive measures were gradually implemented, with the progressive closure of cities and regions, but these had questionable results in relation to the effective control of the spread of the virus. The closure of northern Italy decreed by the central government made many Italians from southern Italy who lived there return to their cities of origin, taking the virus to other regions of the country. As Pisano et al.
9 stated, Italy has followed the rapid spread of the virus, instead of preventing it.
